Local Law 11 Maintenance (May 2013-TBD):   Beginning in May 2013, Rogers Hall and the Othmer Residence Hall will be undergoing exterior repair work required by New York City's Local Law 11. Please be advised of the following construction impacts:      Rogers Hall: Sidewalk bridging (scaffolding) will be erected on all sides of Rogers Hall in June 2013 in preparation for routine repairs to the building’s façade, windows, and supports for air conditioning units.    Othmer Residence Hall: Sidewalk bridging (scaffolding) also will be erected around the Othmer Residence Hall in May 2013 while exterior maintenance is addressed. As a precautionary measure, the backyard of Othmer is closed and will remain closed until further notice. Technorati     Twitter        Facebook     Windows Live     Yahoo                 MySpace     Email                   Bread Crumbs                Home          >           Events Calendar          >           The Transformations Suite                                                                The Transformations Suite   Feb 20, 2015                                   | 5:30 PM-7:30 PM       The Transformations Suite is a composition in five movements that combines spoken word and music. Continuing in the tradition of artists such as Marvin Gaye, Billie Holiday, and Tupac Shakur, the Suite paints a musical picture of the current state of social inequality and injustice in the United States.   Centered in the belief that there is a soundtrack to every revolution, the vision for this piece is that it will foster dialogue on social justice issues throughout the world, contribute to the powerful growing movement on behalf of black lives around the country, and empower all people–especially youth—to make their voices heard.   Featuring:  Samora Abayomi Pinderhughes - Piano, Composer/Creator of the piece  Jeremie Harris - Spoken word  Elena Pinderhughes - Flute & Voice  Jehbreal Muhammad Jackson - Voice  Riley Mulherkar - Trumpet  Braxton Cook - Alto Saxophone  Lucas Pino - Tenor Saxophone  Tony Lustig - Baritone Saxophone  Clovis Nicolas - Bass  Jimmy Macbride - Drums                             Date + Time      Feb 20, 2015                                   | 5:30 PM-7:30 PM              Location      The Jerry L. Labowitz Theatre for the Performing Arts                     Category      Black History Month                       Open to Public?           yes                              RSVP      RSVP                                               top of page                               RSVP                                                                                    NYU Gallatin Footer              Gallatin School of Individualized Study     1 Washington Place     New York, NY 10003     (212) 998-7370                   A–Z Index      Directions      Contact Us      Job Opportunities               News      Support Gallatin      Feedback                         Follow us on Facebook      Follow us on Twitter      Follow us on Youtube         Follow us Instagram                 Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright NYU Gallatin.
